document_info.title: Jungle Spice - Mystery Alkaloids of Mimosa Root Bark
document_info.purpose: Documentation of non-DMT alkaloid fraction from Mimosa
document_info.disclaimer: Educational reference only. Documents historical extraction chemistry research.

definition.description: Non-DMT alkaloid fraction isolated from commercially available Mimosa root bark
definition.general_extraction: Alkaloid fraction obtained from aqueous basic phase by pulling with xylene or toluene AFTER DMT ceases to be pulled by aliphatic hydrocarbon solvents (naphtha, heptane)
definition.composition: Almost always contains some N,N-DMT in addition to mysterious alkaloids

basic_process: Standard A/B extraction to basic aqueous phase
Pull DMT with naphtha/heptane until exhausted
Switch to xylene or toluene for additional pulls

optional_purification.purpose: Remove residual DMT for pure 'jungle' experience

ambiguity_factors.diversity_of_compounds: Great diversity of compounds can be isolated with xylene/toluene
variables_affecting_composition: Source and botanical identity of root bark
ambiguity_factors.certainty: Contains SOME psychoactive material that isn't N,N-DMT

yuremamine_hypothesis.speculation: Compound may be yuremamine (novel phytoindole from M. tenuiflora, characterized 2005)
yuremamine_hypothesis.assessment: Appears EXCEEDINGLY UNLIKELY based on evidence

evidence_against.base_instability: Yuremamine known to be unstable to base
evidence_against.extraction_conditions: Basic conditions in extraction would degrade yuremamine

yuremamine_hypothesis.confirmation_needed: LC-MS with molecular ion at 477.1 m/z would confirm yuremamine
yuremamine_hypothesis.current_conclusion: Safe to assume yuremamine is NOT the red alkaloid isolated by home extractors

appearance.texture: Variable - can be waxy, crystalline, or gooey
appearance.nickname_origin: Red color and 'full spectrum' nature led to 'jungle' name

xylene_toluene.pulls: Wider range of alkaloids including 'jungle' compounds

botanical_confusion.issue: Commercial MHRB may be from different Mimosa species or varieties
botanical_confusion.implication: Alkaloid content varies based on actual botanical source

research_references.analytical_work: Summary of jungle spice analytical work on DMT-Nexus
research_references.main_thread: 'Jungle Spice' - Mystery Alkaloids of Mimosa Root Bark
research_references.pdf: Entropymancer's 'Jungle Spice' - Mystery Alkaloids of Mimosa Root Bark.pdf
research_references.yuremamine_paper: Vepsäläinen JJ et al. 2005. 'Isolation and characterization of yuremamine, a new phytoindole.' Planta Med. 71(11):1053-7

historical_threads.doctorcito_2006: Yuremamine: Solving the Mystery of Jurema Preta? (Ayahuasca Forums)
historical_threads.marsofold_2005: Extraction Of An Alternate Alkaloid From Mimosa (The Nook Forums)
historical_threads.noman_2006: Dark DMT - the Other Alkaloid (DMT-Nexus and Lycaeum)

practical_notes.extraction_tip: Only appears after naphtha/heptane pulls are exhausted
practical_notes.solvent_choice: Xylene or toluene required - won't come out in naphtha
practical_notes.mixing_decision: Personal preference whether to separate from DMT or use mixed
